title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Two Massachusetts men sentenced for stealing and fraudulently depositing mailed checks, pleaded guilty in November 2025.
Imanol Rios-Franco received 35 months prison, one year supervised release, and must pay $12,528 restitution.
Brandon Baez sentenced to two years prison, five years supervised release, ordered to pay $10,285 restitution.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, a Milford High student from Brazil, was detained as a collateral arrest targeting his father.
Gomes' detention sparked local protests and highlighted concerns over immigration enforcement policies.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal but laughed it off as the United States defeated Denmark.
Swayman, facing visibility issues, humorously commented on his colorblindness in postgame interviews.
The United States prepares for its next Olympic match with goaltender options Hellebuyck and Oettinger available.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Kevin Durant expects Jayson Tatum to play at an All-Star level upon his return from an Achilles injury.
Carmelo Anthony believes Jayson Tatum's return could make the Celtics a top threat in the playoffs.
Tatum has been practicing, including time with the Celtics' G League affiliate, ahead of his potential return.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have $41 million in cap space for the 2026 offseason.
Colts wide receiver Alec Pierce is a potential target for the Patriots' receiver needs.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker and Bills C Connor McGovern are viable options to bolster the Patriots' offensive line.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: MLB.TV subscribers can add it to ESPN Unlimited for $134.99, not included in the base ESPN package.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can purchase MLB.TV for $149.99, including a one-month ESPN Unlimited trial.
Existing MLB.TV accounts will auto-renew; ESPN Unlimited is optional but heavily promoted for new subscribers.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, raising speculation about his potential return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, but there's no confirmation of a season return.
Tatum continues rehab from an Achilles tear; Celtics maintain his status as out with no set timetable for return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 analysis, excelling in higher education and public school performance.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree; nearly 22% have graduate degrees, both highest in the U.S.
Vermont and Maryland followed as the second and third most educated states, with Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card with Massachusetts connections is up for auction, closing on February 21.
The Wagner card, kept by the Shields family for 116 years, has a current bid of $3.9 million, totaling $4.76 million with fees.
Ken Goldin, of Netflix's 'King of Collectibles,' manages the auction and highlights its significance in the collecting world.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman is set to start for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage this season.
Connor Hellebuyck will back up Swayman after starting in USA's 5-1 win over Latvia.
